sub_topic: Using the mean value theorem to solve problems
message_1: A car is traveling along a straight road. Between 4 seconds and 8 seconds, the car travels a distance of 60 meters. How fast was the car traveling at some point during this time interval?
message_2:
To find the speed of the car at some point during this time interval, we can calculate the average speed during the 4 seconds interval (between 4 seconds and 8 seconds).

Average speed = (Total distance traveled) / (Time interval)

Total distance traveled = 60 meters
Time interval = 8 seconds - 4 seconds = 4 seconds

Average speed = 60 meters / 4 seconds = 15 meters/second

So, the car was traveling at a speed of 15 meters/second at some point during this time interval.
